caption.title: Influence of introduction scenarios on the estimation of a medium-range dispersal kernel.
caption.p: For each introduction scenario, 10 epidemics were simulated with a medium-range kernel (black dashed curve), and 10 MCMC chains were run per simulated epidemic. The posterior distributions of the kernel obtained under the most exhaustive estimation scheme (Î˜ 4) are represented for all chains with non-negligible mean posterior likelihood. The proportion of MCMC chains with negligible mean posterior likelihood varies among introduction scenarios, with a mean proportion of 2.6%. Kernels are represented by their marginal probability density function f 1 D (top row), and by their marginal cumulative distribution function F 1 D with the distance from the source represented on the natural scale (middle row) or on the log 10 scale (bottom row).
Click here for additional data file.
